events.title: General Election
events.desc: Tennessee voters choose the state's 50th governor. The winner takes office in January 2027, succeeding term-limited Gov. Bill Lee.

events.title: Primary Election
events.desc: Republican and Democratic primary voters select their party nominees. Early voting begins July 17. Tennessee has open primaries — voters choose which party's ballot to use at the polls.

events.title: Filing Deadline — Qualifying Petition Due
events.desc: All candidates must submit qualifying petitions with 25 registered voter signatures by noon. After this date, the field is locked.

events.title: TSS Statewide Education Poll Released
events.desc: Tennesseans for Student Success publishes comprehensive statewide survey of 500 registered voters. Blackburn leads GOP primary at 60.6%, Rose at 8.1%, Fritts at 5.1%. Education findings: 87% support school accountability, 82% back open enrollment, 81% say testing matters, and 64% say education funding isn't spent efficiently.

events.title: Blackburn Files $5.35M Finance Report
events.desc: Blackburn's first campaign finance disclosure reveals massive fundraising: $5.35M raised from 33,000 contributions — so many that it briefly crashed the state's filing system. 22% from Tennessee, 78% from out-of-state donors.

events.title: Beacon Poll: Blackburn 56%, Rose 9%, Fritts 7%
events.desc: Third quarterly Beacon Center/TennSight poll shows Blackburn's lead narrowing from 68% to 56% since August. Rose hasn't gained despite millions in ad spending — stuck at 9%. Fritts rising to 7%. The real story: 28% of Republican voters remain undecided.

events.title: Rose Reports $6.46M War Chest
events.desc: Rose's finance report shows $1.46M raised plus a $5M personal loan, giving him the largest total war chest. 92% of contributions come from Tennessee donors.

events.title: Fritts Calls for Execution Over Trans Care
events.desc: Rep. Monty Fritts appears on a podcast advocating capital punishment for parents, guardians, and medical providers involved in gender-affirming care for minors. The clip goes viral via Right Wing Watch.

events.title: Carnita Atwater Files for Governor
events.desc: Memphis community leader and museum president files her candidacy, entering the Democratic primary. Her third attempt at major office in four years.

events.title: Independents Begin Filing
events.desc: Four independent candidates file: Stephen Maxwell, Lauren Pinkston, Manasa Reddy, and Robert Vick.

events.title: Beacon Poll: Blackburn 58%, Undecideds Surge to 28%
events.desc: Second quarterly Beacon Center poll shows Blackburn dropping 10 points from August while Rose falls from 14% to 9%. Undecided voters double from 14% to 28%, suggesting the race is less locked in than early numbers indicated.

events.title: Monty Fritts Announces at 'Trump Day' Dinner
events.desc: State Rep. Fritts announces his candidacy in Johnson City. Running as anti-establishment — one of ~20 House Republicans who voted against the school voucher bill.

events.title: Marsha Blackburn Enters the Race
events.desc: U.S. Senator Marsha Blackburn announces her candidacy for governor, instantly becoming the Republican frontrunner. Close Trump ally with statewide name recognition.

events.title: First Beacon Poll: Blackburn 68%, Rose 14%
events.desc: First Beacon Center/TennSight poll of the race shows Blackburn with a commanding 54-point lead among likely Republican primary voters. In a hypothetical general, Blackburn leads Green 49-28.

events.title: Jerri Green Enters the Race
events.desc: Memphis City Council member Jerri Green announces her campaign, quickly becoming the leading Democratic candidate. Campaign slogan: 'One Tough Mother.'

events.title: Rose Reports $1.1M in Initial Fundraising
events.desc: Rose's first finance disclosure shows $1.1M raised plus a $5M personal loan. His 92% in-state donor rate becomes a key campaign message.

events.title: Adam 'Ditch' Kurtz Launches Grassroots Campaign
events.desc: Nashville pedal steel guitarist launches his Democratic campaign at The 5 Spot in East Nashville. Running on a no-corporate-money pledge with education as '#1 priority.'

events.title: John Rose Becomes First Major Candidate
events.desc: U.S. Rep. John Rose (TN-6) becomes the first major candidate to formally enter the race. A family farmer, IT businessman, and former Commissioner of Agriculture.
